item.title: GameLikeJam7 Day1 2026
item.description: It’s the start of a new game jam. And the theme is Rogue (1983). My experiment engine of choice is raylib. Excitement builds while I see my 1st web assembly compilation. 1st python 3 local build , viewed on local browser It’s really working!!!!! on actual itch.io draft page. My 1st gamejam I tried to be ambitious and have a c# solution that works for both unity and godot4 and failed at the finishing line this time , I won’t be making that mistake again.

item.title: I Didnt Write the Code I Designed the Logic
item.description: Today, I built a workflow that enables to run a script to convert my online articles on this domain into a book. And by the tags identified , it can compile into a pdf in a nanosecond, ready to be sold as a digital product. A year ago, this might have taken me a week of reading Pandoc documentation , fighting Latex errors and debugging Python scripts. Today , it took me forty minutes and maybe 4 prompts.

item.title: The Task Never Changes
item.description: Most people think consistency gets easier. They think after 60 days, the work becomes automatic. That hasn’t been my experience. The grind itself never gets easier. The weight of the barbell doesn’t change. But you get stronger. You have more tools. You have the memory of past success. Consider “Walking.” To a baby, walking is an impossible struggle. To an adult, walking is effortless. To an elderly person, walking becomes a struggle again.

item.title: 9th Dec 2025 How I Engineered Positive Changes for Myself
item.description: The problem I faced was myself. How I was acting against the good that I wanted to develop for myself. And how I managed to banished the bad, step by step, procedure by procedure. I used to dislike exercise and nowadays without doing a simple set of exercise of 24 diamond push-ups , 30 assisted L-sits. Nowadays I have to do 1 set of it daily unless it doesn’t feel like the day even started for me.

item.title: 8th Dec 2025 Self Coaching
item.description: Lately I have been reading the book - Great Coaching Questions by Nick Howell and applying the learning layer method as much as I can as taught by Justin Sung to get the most of learning. This is the 2nd layer of learning that I am interleaving this week. And I can find myself making new connections when thinking about the material in the book. In the 1st book , what I hypothesize and consider what the book was all about was all about cognitive flexibility and expanding your vision for greater success.

item.title: 7th Dec 2025 Entry The feedback bicycle of Desire,inspiration and action
item.description: Mesotes The idea that virtue exists in balance, not at the extremes. The practiced ability to find the right measure between doing too much and too little in any part of life. As a budding writer writing with the amount of time that I have to properly structure the workload I am given and have to learn each day , it seems hard to even hold on to this writing habit to even progress.

item.title: 6th Dec 2025 -Entry- Getting Better
item.description: Getting Better Tracking my progress over time , I can tell that I am getting better and not deluding myself , but the growth is more rewarding than I first assumed and slower than I thought. I can focus now easily for at least 5 hrs attending to key tasks everyday that makes me work and my work ethic and discipline is getting better. The more failures I go through the more I am aware of the pitfalls that are encroaching me even when they are not yet close and I can start preparing for them.

item.title: 4th Dec 2025 Expanding Fdf
item.description: Breaking my own limits - Wrongful effort applied perhaps 3 hours of concentrated tireless work , breaking not just the limit of the project but also the limits of my frustration and focus as well , despite being the “worst” time of my current limits , it was also the “best” improvement I could have made for myself. I didn’t know a simple map loading would take so much out of me , so much to learn and to consider and so much to appreciate about the work of others to make something simple and to make it work the way I envisioned it in my mind.

item.title: 3rd Dec 2025 Entry Learnings and Reflections
item.description: Feeling the heat..to remain on the path. Making progress but not enough , not deep enough to make a dent in the amount of expertise to be counted as good enough. Writing just because I have decided and made a point to write even when my thoughts are not gathered and this is my way of outputting even when my mind is racing and disorganized , making progress in my godot project.

item.title: 2nd Dec 2025 All It Takes Within to Continue the Habit
item.description: Just before I sleep , so I can rest in peace. All it takes of me , is the effort of a tremendeous struggle , but a choice made not in heat but one of committed deed. To choose to write when uninspired , when all within is calling me to retire. When all I feel is doubt all around , but I push back with my fingers lightly pounding on this sliver chasis.

item.title: 1st Dec 2025 2nd Entry Recursive Learning
item.description: Being aware of learning as a recursive activity rather than a straight-forward one. Learning is not a one and done like most people assume it to be.And often it is less straight-forward than initially assumed. Let’s take the learning goal of wanting to master git for the purposes of wanting to get better at cooperating as a software engineer. But besides the layer of communication that happens at each level of push-pull , committing and branching.

item.title: 1st Dec 2025 Entry - Writing Out Loud
item.description: This is my 10th post for chaining my writing behavior. The one thing that I am reflecting on right now is that how clarity makes a difference in progress, when I have a clear picture of what to do and it removes the miasma of uncertainty , it allows me to leverage much more of my energy to execute on what matters and when I progress , it just feels so good especially if I feel stuck on it for quite some time.

item.title: 25th_Nov_Entry
item.description: List to do for fdf - estimated time 4 - 5 days + 3 evals ( 1 day ) Made massive progress for fdf today. item.title: 23rd Nov 2025 Writing Habit
item.description: Introduction It has not been easily to be vulnerable , to take in all the mistakes I am making and will continue to make in pursuit of my goals. To be accepting of who I am and yet be seeking to be more. What a oxymoron it feels to be human and yet it feels like to be human is to be like this all the time. To monitor one’s growth and thoughts over the time and effort it takes to transform, it is a really humbling path to be taking day-in and day-out.
